name: Dreamhost Shared Hosting CPU Usage
author: Bernardo Bauer

sections.description:
DHSHCU stands for Dreamhost Shared Hosting CPU Usage. This plugin makes the life of the blogger easier to track CPU Usage of it’s WordPress powered blog.

What the plugin does, under the microscope, is get the file with the CPU Usage for one day that Dreamhosts generates, input it to the wordpress database and display the last 7 days collected.
sections.installation:
No mistery here.

  1. Upload the files in the zipfile to /wp-content/plugins/
  2. Activate the plugin
  3. Configure it. Don’t forget to activate Dreamhost’s CPU monitoring. Don’t worry. The plugin will warn you if you don’t know if CPU monitoring is on or not.
sections.faq:
How do I know it CPU Monitoring is on or not?

You should read [this](http://wiki.dreamhost.com/index.php/CPU_Resources_FAQ#Where_can_I_find_resource_reports.3F this).

I would like to translate this plugin to my language

No problem. The plugin ships with POT file so you can translate it to any language you like. Please get in touch with [me](http://www.bernabauer.com/contato me) so I can include your translation in the next update.

I activated it, where is the stuff?

There is an configuration menu under Options and another menu under Manage. The CPU Usage is under Manage.
